abstracts.cdata!:
This result profile talks about Mekong
            Delta’s Water Resource Project in Vietnam. In 1999, the
            Mekong Delta’s agriculture accounted for 30 percent of
            Vietnam’s Gross Domestic Product (GDP) and more than 80
            percent of its rice exports. However, without appropriate
            infrastructure, the Ddelta’s many canals and irrigation
            networks were vulnerable to salt water intruding from the
            South China Sea during the dry season and flooding during
            the rainy season, thereby threatening the quality of farm
            soil and the reliability of harvests. Poor drinking water
            supply and inadequate rural transport also held back
            production levels and rural incomes.
